page.title: 13HEMINGBY ALMSHOUSES & SCHOOL
page.content: A plaque on the Almshouses announces " This Hospital and school were erected in the year 1727 by Jane Dymoke." Jane was widow of the Hon. Charles Dymoke of Scrivelsby Court. Charles Dymoke was the champion of England and his descendant Colonel Dymoke who still lives in Scrivelsby is now champion of England. The Almshouses originally were four houses for poor widows and a house for a schoolmistress.Jane Dymoke also built and endowed a free school for poor children with provision for the poorer ones and an apprenticeship scheme for boys.The boys had their own school which is now a village hall. The girls were taught by the schoolmistress in the middle Almshouse cottage where she lived.Later the girls were allowed the use of the church Sunday school.
